text: Wine-Searcher is the world's largest global search engine
and price comparison engine for wine, spirits, and beers.

We're genuinely global.
We have users at every point of the day
pushing our systems as hard as they can.
We've been hosting our own web services for 22 years
and we found that we need to move to a more modern environment,

something that can scale, something with
better performance and resilience.
Running your own on premise or colocation services
just doesn't work in today's world.
We run a Linux, Apache, Oracle, SOLR PHP kind of environment.
We migrated our development environment across to AWS first.
The nature of our business is very technically challenging.

We pick up 25,000 price lists from around the world
pretty much every day,

pull all that information together
and match it against a master product file
and make that searchable for users.
That's a really challenging problem, and you need to be able to scale very quickly, you need high speed systems.

That requires a lot of infrastructure
and a lot of reliable systems that run 24 by seven.
You can't be down even for a second.

Customers get a great experience because the service is faster,
more resilient, and always available.

Working with AWS locally means that
we get the support we need,
but we're also allowed space to migrate our systems, to implement new systems as we need to.
Our initial experiments with AWS were really based around providing a disaster recovery solution for our on premise and colocation services.
So we're really just dipping our toes in the water of what AWS can do.
